Welcome!

This is the personal website of Hannah Haberkern.
I'm a neuroscientist studying visually guided navigation in fruit flies. Activities I enjoy in my free time include sewing, gardening and observing animals.


1

My research

Broadly speaking, I am interested in understanding how environment and past experiences shape the behavior of animals. I do experiments in the lab, but also spend a lot of time on my computer analyzing data.

More science!

2a

Some sewing projects

If you like to learn more, visit my blog! Also, you might have noticed: I like orange, turquoise and green.

--> To my blog

3

I love plants!

Having them around me in my apartment, watching them grow in my garden or admiring strange species in parks and botanical gardens.

2b

Sewing materials

My sewing machine and a small selection of my fabric stash. Sadly, I don't have too much time to sew right now.

4

Dry eyes etc...

Due to a chronic autoimmune condition called Sjögren's Syndrome, I have to take daily medication.

More about Sjögren's Syndrome!

5

Painting and photography

I enjoy closely observing animals, plants and landscapes, which is – I think – why I'm drawn to both painting and photography.

In the image above I've collected a few things representing important aspects of my life. I should add that neither my family nor partner feature here, though of course they play a huge role in my life! Click on the hotspots to find out more!
